intro: Psychotria catillicalyx, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
